kieker.monitoring.core.controller.tcp

Class AbstractTcpReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • kieker.monitoring.core.controller.tcp.AbstractTcpReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractRecordTcpReader, SingleSocketRecordReader

    public abstract class AbstractTcpReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Represents a TCP reader without any knowledge about Kieker in general and records in particular.
    Since:
    1.13
    Author:
    Christian Wulf (chw)

        public AbstractTcpReader(int port,
                         int bufferCapacity,
                         org.slf4j.Logger logger)
        Constructs a new TCP reader.
        Parameters:
        port - on which to listen for requests
        bufferCapacity - of the used read buffer
        logger - for notification to users and developers

      • AbstractTcpReader

        public AbstractTcpReader(int port,
                         int bufferCapacity,
                         org.slf4j.Logger logger,
                         boolean respawn)
        Constructs a new TCP reader.
        Parameters:
        port - on which to listen for requests
        bufferCapacity - of the used read buffer
        logger - for notification to users and developers
        respawn - respawn reading after connection is lost

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public final void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • onBufferReceived

        protected abstract boolean onBufferReceived(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Parameters:
        buffer - to be read from
        Returns:
        • true when there were enough bytes to perform the read operation
        • false otherwise. In this case, the buffer is reset, compacted, and filled with new content.

        Gracefully terminates this TCP reader.
